definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The old organ wheezed out a tune.
sentences.chinese: 那架老风琴呜呜地奏出曲子。

sentences.english: He made everything so simple, it was like magic.
sentences.chinese: 他的曲子很简单，就好像魔术。

sentences.english: This tune is usually attributed to Chopin.
sentences.chinese: 这个曲子通常认为是萧邦写的。

sentences.english: Do you think this music is well-matched?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得这支曲子配得好吗？

sentences.english: He felt rather sad at that piece of music.
sentences.chinese: 听到那首曲子时，她感到挺伤心的。

sentences.english: The first class that morning was music. He played a tune on the violin.
sentences.chinese: 那天的第一堂课是音乐，他用小提琴演奏了一首曲子。

sentences.english: When he began to play a tune,we had our first glimpse of the snake.
sentences.chinese: 当他开始吹奏一支曲子时，我们才第一次看到那条蛇。

sentences.english: The steel band from across the street struck up another tune.
sentences.chinese: 街对面的金属乐队换了首曲子。

sentences.english: Don't worry about piracy for this song.
sentences.chinese: 不要担心这首曲子被盗版。

sentences.english: His piece was written by the Italian master Muzio Clementi.
sentences.chinese: 他的曲子是意大利大师穆齐奥克莱门蒂的作品。

sentences.english: Probably the songs most defining feature is the vocal talent.
sentences.chinese: 这首曲子也最能突出她那天生的好嗓音。

sentences.english: John was humming a tune when he put on his clothes.
sentences.chinese: 约翰一边穿衣服一边哼着曲子。

sentences.english: The songs were arranged by another well-known bass player.
sentences.chinese: 这些曲子后经另一名著名男低音歌手改编。

sentences.english: Here, you can use notes to make sounds.
sentences.chinese: 这个程序你可以用音符写曲子。

sentences.english: And yellow leaves of autumn which have no songs , flutter and fall there with a sign.
sentences.chinese: 秋天的落叶，它们曲子可唱，一声叹息，飘零在地上。

sentences.english: The music seems out of tune to our Western ears, but it has charm.
sentences.chinese: 这曲子我们西方人听起来不太悦耳，不过挺迷人的。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
